Air pollution and air quality trends

(lower is better) AQI NO2 SO2 Ozone

Air Quality Index (AQI) level in 2021 was 47.5. This is significantly better than average.

City: 47.5U.S.: 72.6

Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) [ppb] level in 2014 was 2.55. This is significantly better than average. Closest monitor was 1.2 miles away from the city center.

City: 2.55U.S.: 5.11

Sulfur Dioxide (SO2) [ppb] level in 2021 was 0.0682. This is significantly better than average. Closest monitor was 1.2 miles away from the city center.

City: 0.0682U.S.: 1.5147

Ozone [ppb] level in 2021 was 30.4. This is about average. Closest monitor was 1.2 miles away from the city center.

City: 30.4U.S.: 33.3

Tornado activity:

Lewes-area historical tornado activity is below Delaware state average. It is 58% smaller than the overall U.S. average.

On 8/12/1955, a category F2 (max. wind speeds 113-157 mph) tornado 17.0 miles away from the Lewes city center injured one person and caused between $500 and $5000 in damages.

On 4/28/2002, a category F3 (max. wind speeds 158-206 mph) tornado 47.0 miles away from the city center caused $150,000 in damages.

Earthquake activity:

Lewes-area historical earthquake activity is significantly above Delaware state average. It is 67% smaller than the overall U.S. average.

On 8/23/2011 at 17:51:04, a magnitude 5.8 (5.8 MW, Depth: 3.7 mi, Class: Moderate, Intensity: VI - VII) earthquake occurred 163.0 miles away from the city center

On 1/16/1994 at 01:49:16, a magnitude 4.6 (4.6 MB, 4.6 LG, Depth: 3.1 mi, Class: Light, Intensity: IV - V) earthquake occurred 117.6 miles away from the city center

On 11/30/2017 at 21:47:31, a magnitude 4.1 (4.1 MW, Depth: 6.1 mi) earthquake occurred 33.1 miles away from Lewes center

On 1/15/2019 at 23:30:48, a magnitude 4.6 (4.6 MW, Depth: 6.2 mi) earthquake occurred 157.8 miles away from Lewes center

On 8/25/2011 at 05:07:52, a magnitude 4.5 (4.5 ML, Depth: 4.2 mi) earthquake occurred 163.6 miles away from the city center

On 12/9/2003 at 20:59:14, a magnitude 4.5 (4.5 MB, 4.5 LG) earthquake occurred 171.1 miles away from Lewes center

Magnitude types: regional Lg-wave magnitude (LG), body-wave magnitude (MB), local magnitude (ML), moment magnitude (MW)

2002 - 2018 National Fire Incident Reporting System (NFIRS) incidents

Based on the data from the years 2002 - 2018 the average number of fires per year is 66. The highest number of fire incidents - 99 took place in 2007, and the least - 47 in 2013. The data has a growing trend.

When looking into fire subcategories, the most incidents belonged to: Structure Fires (48.5%), and Outside Fires (36.1%).
